naturalClock.title: Natural Clock
naturalClock.description:
I am a clock inspired by nature.
My hand turns only once a day...
I follow the course of the sun in the sky,
quietly... on a 360° dial.

thirteenMoons.title: 13 Moons Spiral
thirteenMoons.description:
Inspired by traditions from around the world,
my 13 months of 28 days replace
our old twisted calendar.
The rainbow day closes the year.

hero.description:
Natural Time reinvents our way of measuring time.
With the {clock} and the {spiral},
the sun regains its place as a universal reference
for the passing of time...

understanding.title: Understanding
understanding.subtitle: natural time
understanding.mission:
Natural Time is a time measurement system
designed to replace (or complement)
the 24-hour clock and the Gregorian calendar.

closing.line1: We created machines to measure time.
closing.line2: Then we became slaves to their ticking.
closing.line4: Life has already provided the most beautiful clock...
closing.line5: We call it the sun! Master of time and conductor of all living things.

meta.title: Natural Time - A new way to measure time, inspired by nature
meta.description: Discover and understand the 360° natural clock synchronized with the sun and the 13 moons spiral of 28 days

welcome.description: Discover a simpler and more logical way to measure the passing of time in a day

step1.title: I am a natural clock
step1.description: I point towards the sun at all times

step2.title: My single hand
step2.description: Turns slowly, only once a day

step3.title: My dial is graduated in 360°
step3.description: Goodbye to 24 hours, 60 minutes, and 60 seconds

step4.title: 180° marks true noon
step4.description: When the sun is at its zenith

step5.title: 0° marks the true middle of the night
step5.description: When the sun is on the other side of the Earth

step6.title: The mustaches represent day and night
step6.description: According to the season and latitude

step11.title: On equinox days (only)
step11.description: The duration of day equals that of night

step12.title: We no longer ask "What time is it?"
step12.description: But rather: "Where is the sun in the sky?"

step14.title: The numbers are optional
step14.description: The natural clock is above all a visual experience

end.title: Tutorial completed!
end.description: To continue, the application needs to configure a geographic location

welcome.description: Discover the 13 Moons Spiral, a universal calendar 100% based on nature

step1.title: I am a calendar with 13 months of 28 days

step3.title: Each day of the week has a color

step4.title: Then Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo

step5.title: The 13 moons are arranged in a spiral
step5.description: Because time is not linear but rather cyclical

step6.title: Here is the 5th day of the 5th moon

step7.title: And here: the 11th day of the 11th moon
step7.description: A green day... Regardless of the year, century, or millennium...

step8.title: Did you know? 13 x 28 = 364 days 🤩
step8.description: With one more day, we get 365 days

step9.title: It's called the rainbow day 🌈
step9.description: A day of celebration that takes place during the winter solstice of the northern hemisphere

step10.title: Some years have 366 days instead of 365
step10.description: It's an opportunity to celebrate two consecutive days outside of time

step11.title: A natural date is written: YEAR ) MOON ) DAY

step12.title: The 1st day of year 001
step12.description: corresponds to December 22, 2012 in the Gregorian calendar (see FAQ)

step13.title: Last important detail
step13.description: The 28 days do not correspond to the 29.53 days of the full/new moon cycle (See FAQ)

end.title: Tutorial completed!
end.description: To continue, the application needs to configure a geographic location
